item.title: Lifecycle Layer
item.description: Framework Specification (Lifecycle Layer) and Framework Launching

item.title: Service Layer
item.description: Framework Specification (Service Layer)

item.title: Resource API Specification
item.description: API for the generic Requirement-Capability model

item.title: Bundle Wiring API Specification
item.description: API to introspect the wiring between the requirements and capabilities of resolved bundles.

item.title: Package Admin Service Specification
item.description: The Package Admin service provides an interface to let the Management Agent make the decision regarding any shared packages when the exporting bundle is uninstalled or updated.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.packageadmin` package is specified in chapter 5
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.packageadmin` package is specified in chapter 3

notes.note: After 4.2.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.packageadmin` package is no longer specified

item.title: Framework Namespaces Specification
item.description: A Namespace defines the semantics of a Requirement-Capability pair.

item.title: Start Level Service Specification
item.description: This specification describes how to enable a Management Agent to control the relative starting and stopping order of bundles in an OSGi Service Platform.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.startlevel` package is specified in chapter 6

notes.note: After 4.2.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.startlevel` service functionality is moved to `org.osgi.framework.startlevel` API

item.title: Start Level API Specification
item.description: This specification describes how to enable a management agent to control the relative starting and stopping order of bundles in an OSGi framework.

version.note: In 4.3.0 specification, `org.osgi.framework.startlevel` package is specified in chapter 8

item.title: Framework API
item.description: Framework Specification (Lifecycle Layer and Service Layer), Framework Launching, OSGi Versioning Annotations Package, OSGi Bundle Annotations Package

item.title: Jini Driver Service Specification
item.description: This specification outlines the rules for using Jini in an OSGi Service Platform.

item.title: Conditional Permission Admin Service Specification
item.description: This specification adds several new features to the Java permission model to adapt it to the typical use cases of OSGi deployments.

notes.note: Until 4.2.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.condpermadmin` package is specified in chapter 9

item.title: Permission Admin Service Specification
item.description: Permission Admin service used to administrate the permissions of a bundle and provide defaults for all bundles.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.permissionadmin` package is specified in chapter 7
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.permissionadmin` package is specified in chapter 4

notes.note: The Permission Admin has been superseded by the Conditional Permission Admin.
Until 4.2.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.permissionadmin` package is specified in chapter 10

item.title: URL Handlers Service Specification
item.description: This specification standardizes the mechanism to extend the Java runtime with new URL schemes and content handlers through bundles.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.url` package is specified in chapter 8

notes.note: Until 4.2.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.url` package is specified in chapter 11

item.title: Resolver Hook Service Specification
item.description: The module layer is responsible for the resolve operation that wires requirements (Import-Package, Require-Bundle etc.) to capabilities (Export-Package, Bundle-SymbolicName/Bundle-Version etc.).

item.title: Bundle Hook Service Specification
item.description: Bundle Hook services allow Handlers to hide bundles from other bundles by filtering the Bundle Events and return values of methods that return bundles.

item.title: Service Hook Service Specification
item.description: The service hooks provide a more symmetric model for service based programming that can act as a multiplier for the framework. The basic framework provides a powerful service engine and this specification allows a bundle to interact with this service engine.

notes.note: In 4.2.0 specification, `org.osgi.framework.hooks.service` package is specified in chapter 12

item.title: Weaving Hook Service Specification
item.description: This specification provides a means for a handler bundle to intercept any bundle class loading calls in the framework, transform the byte codes, and add new dynamic imports.

item.title: Data Transfer Objects Specification
item.description: This specification defines Data Transfer Objects for OSGi in general and well as specific Data Transfer Objects for the Core specification.

item.title: Resolver Service Specification
item.description: The OSGi Resolver service is an essential part of a software model where applications are built out of independent components.

notes.note: In 7.0.0, Resolver Service Specification was moved from OSGi Compendium, Chapter 136 to Core specification

item.title: Tracker Specification
item.description: This specification defines two utility classes, ServiceTracker and BundleTracker, that make tracking services and bundles easier.

version.note: In 4.3.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.tracker` package is specified in chapter 701 of compendium specification
In 4.2.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.tracker` package is specified in chapter 701 of compendium specification
In 4.1.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.tracker` package is specified in chapter 701 of compendium specification
In 4.0.1 specification, `org.osgi.util.tracker` package is specified in chapter 701 of compendium specification
In 4.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.tracker` package is specified in chapter 701 of compendium specification
In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.tracker` package is specified in chapter 19
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.tracker` package is specified in chapter 5

item.title: Remote Services
item.description: A distribution provider can use this loose coupling between bundles to export a registered service by creating an endpoint.

notes.note: In 4.2.0 Remote Services were specified in chapter 13
In 4.3.0 Remote Services were moved to core (but I wasn't able to find relevant chapter)
In 5.0.0 Remote Services are back to chapter 100 of compendium specification
This specification doesn't declare any packages

item.title: Log Service Specification
item.description: The Log Service provides a general purpose message logger for the OSGi Service Platform.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.log` package is specified in chapter 9 of core specification
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.log` package is specified in chapter 6 of core specification

item.title: Http Service Specification
item.description: The Http Service supports techniques for registering servlets and registering resources.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.http` package is specified in chapter 14 of core specification
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.http` package is specified in chapter 7 of core specification

item.title: Device Access Specification
item.description: The Device Access specification supports the coordination of automatic detection and attachment of existing devices on an OSGi Service Platform, facilitates hot-plugging and unplugging of new devices, and downloads and installs device drivers on demand.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.device` package is specified in chapter 11 of core specification
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.device` package is specified in chapter 8 of core specification

item.title: Configuration Admin Service Specification
item.description: The Configuration Admin service allows an Operator to set the configuration information of deployed bundles.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.cm` package is specified in chapter 10 of core specification
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.cm` package is specified in chapter 9 of core specification

item.title: Metatype Service Specification
item.description: The Metatype specification defines interfaces that allow bundle developers to describe attribute types in a computer readable form using so-called meta data.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.metatype` package is specified in chapter 18 of core specification
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.metatype` package is specified in chapter 10 of core specification

item.title: Preferences Service Specification
item.description: Preferences Service Specification is intended to replace java.util.Properties with a more sophisticated mechanism.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.prefs` package is specified in chapter 15 of core specification
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.prefs` package is specified in chapter 11 of core specification

item.title: User Admin Service Specification
item.description: The User Admin service provides functionality to verify that a principal is authorized to perform the requested action.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.useradmin` package is specified in chapter 12 of core specification
In 2.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.useradmin` package is specified in chapter 12 of core specification

item.title: Wire Admin Service Specification
item.description: The Wire Admin service is an administrative service that is used to control a wiring topology in the OSGi Service Platform.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.wireadmin` package is specified in chapter 16 of core specification

item.title: IO Connector Service Specification
item.description: IO Connector Service specification adopts the Java 2 Micro Edition (J2ME) javax.microedition.io packages as a basic communications infrastructure.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.io` package is specified in chapter 13 of core specification

item.title: Initial Provisioning
item.description: This specification defines how the Management Agent can make its way to the Service Platform, and gives a structured view of the problems and their corresponding resolution methods.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.provisioning` package is specified in chapter 26 of core specification

item.title: UPnP Device Service Specification
item.description: This specification specifies how OSGi bundles can be developed that interoperate with UPnPâ„¢ (Universal Plug and Play) devices and UPnP control points.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.service.upnp` package is specified in chapter 25 of core specification

item.title: Declarative Services Specification
item.description: The service component model uses a declarative model for publishing, finding and binding to OSGi services.

item.title: Event Admin Service Specification
item.description: The Event Admin service provides an inter-bundle communication mechanism.

item.title: Deployment Admin Specification
item.description: Deployment Admin service standardizes the access to some of the responsibilities of the management agent: that is, the lifecycle management of interlinked resources on an OSGi Service Platform.

item.title: Auto Configuration Specification
item.description: The purpose of the Auto Configuration specification is to allow the configuration of bundles.

notes.note: Auto Configuration is introduced in OSGi Compendium 4.1, but doesn't declare any packages.

item.title: Application Admin Service Specification
item.description: The OSGi Application Admin service is intended to simplify the management of an environment with many different types of applications that are simultaneously available.

item.title: DMT Admin Service Specification
item.description: This specification defines an API for managing a device using concepts from the OMA DM specifications.

item.title: Monitor Admin Service Specification
item.description: This specification outlines how a bundle can publish Status Variables and how administrative bundles can discover Status Variables as well as read and reset their values.

item.title: Foreign Application Access Specification
item.description: The purpose of this specification is to enable foreign applications to participate in the OSGi service oriented architecture.

item.title: Blueprint Container Specification
item.description: This specification defines a dependency injection framework, specifically for OSGi bundles, that understands the unique dynamic nature of services.

item.title: Remote Service Admin Service Specification
item.description: The basic model for OSGi remote services is that a bundle can register services that are exported to a communication Endpoint and use services that are imported from a communication Endpoint.

item.title: JTA Transaction Services Specification
item.description: This specification provides an OSGi service based design for the Java Transaction Architecture (JTA) Specification.

notes.note: JTA Transaction Services Specification is introduced in OSGi Compendium 4.3, but doesn't specify any packages.

item.title: JDBC Service Specification
item.description: This specification defines how OSGi-aware JDBC drivers can provide access to their implementations.

item.title: JNDI Services Specification
item.description: This specification will define how JNDI can be utilized from within an OSGi framework.

item.title: JPA Service Specification
item.description: This specification is about the unmanaged model of JPA except in the areas where the managed model is explicitly mentioned.

item.title: Web Applications Specification
item.description: This specification defines the Web Application Bundle, which is a bundle that performs the same role as the WAR in Java EE.

notes.note: Web Applications Specification is introduced in OSGi Compendium 4.3, but doesn't specify any packages.

item.title: SCA Configuration Type Specification
item.description: This specification is based on the SCA Assembly specification v1.1 CD03 and SCA Policy Framework specification v1.1 CD02.

notes.note: SCA Configuration Type Specification is introduced in OSGi Compendium 4.3, but doesn't specify any packages.
SCA Configuration Type Specification is removed in 5.0.0.

item.title: Coordinator Service Specification
item.description: This Coordinator service provides an explicit Coordination model, the Coordination is explicitly passed as a parameter, and an implicit model where the Coordination is associated with the current thread.

item.title: Repository Service Specification
item.description: This Repository Service Specification provides the capability to manage the external access to components and other resources.

item.title: Service Loader Mediator Specification
item.description: This specification defines a mediator that ensures that the JavaSE 6+ Service Loader is useful in an OSGi Framework.

item.title: Subsystem Service Specification
item.description: The Subsystems specification defines resolution and provisioning rules to help management agents consistently deploy collections of resources.

item.title: Common Namespaces Specification
item.description: This section defines a number of Namespaces that are not part of the OSGi Core Release 5 specification.

item.title: REST Management Service Specification
item.description: This specification describes a REST interface for framework management, client-side Java and JavaScript APIs, and an extension mechanism through which other bundles can contribute their own RESTful management APIs and make them discoverable by clients.

item.title: Asynchronous Service Specification
item.description: The purpose of the Asynchronous Service is to bridge the gap between these existing, primarily synchronous, services in the OSGi service registry, and asynchronous programming.

item.title: Http Whiteboard Specification
item.description: OSGi Http Whiteboard Specification provides a light and convenient way of using servlets, servlet filters, servlet listeners and web resources in an OSGi environment through the use of the Whiteboard Pattern.

item.title: Transaction Control Service Specification
item.description: The purpose of the Transaction Control Service is to enable a portable, modular abstraction for Transaction lifecycle management and to allow different resource types to be easily used within a Transaction.

item.title: Cluster Information Specification
item.description: An API for a management agent to discover, list and inspect available nodes in the cluster.

item.title: Configurator Specification
item.description: This specification defines a mechanism to feed configurations into the Configuration Admin Service through configuration resources.

item.title: JAX-RS Whiteboard Specification
item.description: The OSGi JAX-RS Whiteboard Specification provides a light and convenient way of using JAX-RS POJOs, applications and extensions in an OSGi environment through the use of the Whiteboard Pattern.

item.title: XML Parser Service Specification
item.description: A common XML Parser in an embedded environment.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.xml` package is specified in chapter 17 of core specification

item.title: Position Specification
item.description: The Position class is a utility providing bundle developers with a consistent way of handling geographic positions in OSGi applications.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.position` package is specified in chapter 21 of core specification

item.title: Measurement and State Specification
item.description: The Measurement class is a utility that provides a consistent way of handling a diverse range of measurements for bundle developers.

version.note: In 3.0.0 specification, `org.osgi.util.measurement` package is specified in chapter 20 of core specification

item.title: Promises Specification
item.description: This specification defines a Promises API which can be used on many versions of Java including Java 5 and Java ME CDC/Foundation.

item.title: Push Stream Specification
item.description: This specification defines a PushStream API which can be used on devices which support the Java 8 compact profile.

item.title: Converter Specification
item.description: This specification defines the OSGi Converter that makes it easy to convert many types to other types, including scalars, Collections, Maps, Beans, Interfaces and DTOs without having to write the boilerplate conversion code.
